content.title: Tool Kit Grant for Traditional Handicrafts Experts
content.details: A sizeable population of OBCs is engaged in traditional occupations like handicrafts, jewellery making, metalwork, weaving, etc. Due to these low-paid occupations and due to modern technological intervention they face tough competition in the market which creates a feeling of inferiority and incapacity threatening their very existence. In order to have the traditional occupation as a sustainable self-employment and income-generating source for the families of traditional craftsmen their traditional skills need to be upgraded and they need to be equipped with modern technology to meet the market demands. The scheme is intended for the above purpose of improving the productivity and competitiveness of the traditional OBC craftsmen ensuring quality goods for enhanced income and thereby qualitative improvement in their living conditions.
benefits: The training costs, stipend (if found necessary), and tool kit grant together shall be limited to ₹25000/-
The training and stipend portion is limited to ₹5000/-
The maximum period of training will be three months
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of the Kerala State
The applicant should belong to the State Backward Communities of Kerala State
The applicant should be engaged in traditional craftwork/skilled work
The upper age limit of the applicant should be 60 years
The annual family income of the applicant should be ₹1,00,000/-
exclusions: The grant should not be used as working capital
content.application_process: Offline. The application will be invited through public notification in all the leading news dailies. Applicants should apply in the prescribed form with all relevant documents and submit it to the Regional Deputy Director.
documents_required: Certificate regarding Non-receipt of other grants from LSGD, KADCO, etc.

faqs.question: What is the “Tool Kit Grant for Traditional Handicrafts Experts” scheme?
faqs.answer: The “Tool Kit Grant for Traditional Handicrafts Experts” scheme is launched for the purpose of improving the productivity and competitiveness of the traditional OBC craftsmen ensuring quality goods for enhanced income and thereby qualitative improvement in their living conditions.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to create awareness among the skilled and semiskilled OBC workers on the need to adopt new technology in the highly technological era, for meeting the market needs, ensure sustainable self-employment for fair livelihood and ensure social justice through the overall economic development of the traditional craftsmen communities.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Backward Communities Development Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The person who is engaged in traditional craftwork/skilled work and belongs to the Other Backward Community of Kerala is eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The grant of ₹25000/- shall be given to the eligible person for his/her training, stipend (if found necessary) and tool kits.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the training?
faqs.answer: The maximum period of training will be three months.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the Backward Communities of Kerala State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should belong to the State Backward Communities of Kerala State.

faqs.question: What is the criterion for annual family income under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The annual family income of the applicant from all sources does not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Who will be given preference under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The preference will be given to those having more than two girl children, differently abled person and those having more than 10 years of experience.

faqs.question: What is the maximum age limit of the applicant?
faqs.answer: The upper age limit of the applicant should be 60 years.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicants should apply in the prescribed form with all relevant documents and submit it to the Regional Deputy Director.
